result.execSummary:
Mark T. Zawadzki Jr. was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Mark T. Zawadzki Jr. was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Angelina Gabriele appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Carmen Lassiter.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Def. waived extradition to Lake Co., Illinois.  Waiver of Extradition signed.

150pm
  Special Prosecutor Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the State.   Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney C Lassiter.  Clerk LE.  Referred to Br 8 for further dispo on 10/3/14 @ 830am.  Deft wishes to waive extradition.  $5000  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).
and witness list filed by the State
